'''Moblin''', short for mobile [[Linux]], is an [[open source]] [[operating system]] and application stack for [[Mobile Internet Device]]s (MIDs), [[netbook]]s, and [[nettop]]s.<ref>[http://moblin.org/community/netbooks/moblin_netbook_nettop.php Moblin.org - Mobile Linux Internet Project<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Built around the [[Intel Atom]] processor, current builds are designed to minimize boot times and power consumption to create a netbook and MID-centric operating system. The netbook/desktop version of Moblin currently supports other chipsets based on the [[SSSE3]] instruction set, such as the [[Core2]] and some [[Celeron]] processors. Commercial products built around Moblin 2 include a [[Foxconn]] netbook<ref name=LinpusFoxcon>http://www.slashgear.com/foxconn-sz901-netbook-with-linpus-lite-moblin-v2-video-2945348/</ref> and an [[InvenTech]] [[smartphone]]<ref>http://www.midmoves.com/2009/06/mr-blurrycam-spots-a-mediaphone/</ref>, both announced at [[Computex]] 2009. [[Acer]] has also announced the replacement of [[Linpus]] Linux with Moblin on their [[Acer Aspire]] netbooks.<ref name="LinpusFoxconn"/><ref>[http://tech.yahoo.com/news/pcworld/20090603/tc_pcworld/acerwillusemoblinlinuxacrossitsproducts Yahoo news "Acer Will Use Moblin Linux Across Its Products]</ref>
'''Moblin''', short for mobile [[Linux]], is an [[open source]] [[operating system]] and application stack for [[Mobile Internet Device]]s (MIDs), [[netbook]]s, and [[nettop]]s.<ref>[http://moblin.org/community/netbooks/moblin_netbook_nettop.php Moblin.org - Mobile Linux Internet Project<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Built around the [[Intel Atom]] processor, current builds are designed to minimize boot times and power consumption to create a netbook and MID-centric operating system. The netbook/desktop version of Moblin currently supports other chipsets based on the [[SSSE3]] instruction set, such as the [[Core2]] and some [[Celeron]] processors. Commercial products built around Moblin 2 include a [[Foxconn]] netbook<ref name=LinpusFoxcon>http://www.slashgear.com/foxconn-sz901-netbook-with-linpus-lite-moblin-v2-video-2945348/</ref> and an [[InvenTech]] [[smartphone]]<ref>http://www.midmoves.com/2009/06/mr-blurrycam-spots-a-mediaphone/</ref>, both announced at [[Computex]] 2009. [[Acer]] has also announced the replacement of [[Linpus]] Linux with Moblin on their [[Acer Aspire]] netbooks.<ref name="LinpusFoxconn"/><ref>[http://tech.yahoo.com/news/pcworld/20090603/tc_pcworld/acerwillusemoblinlinuxacrossitsproducts Yahoo news "Acer Will Use Moblin Linux Across Its Products]</ref>
